Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 34 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 8/25/1988]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 34 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 8/25/1988]

Pride and ProgressSpecial Episode: Coverage of 1988 Republican and Democratic National Conventions â€“ highlights:COMMERCIAL: The "Tyte" Party Line, for men only1. History of gay rights movement.2. On RNC floor, interviews with Evan Meecham, Al D'Amato, John Roberts, Jim Fenalson, Jonathan Bush, Henry Kissinger, and Marvin Bush, who are questioned about political issues affecting the gay community.3. At DNC, interviews with Sgt. Perry Watkins, Karen Clark, Mike Farrell, Martin Hiraga, and Ted Weiss, who are questioned about political issues affecting the gay community.COMMERCIAL: Gay Pride Parade & Christopher Street Festival 1988 video4. Interview with Urvashi Vaid.COMMERCIAL: 550-9000, presented by the Megaquest Group5. NO/AIDS Task Force Resource Center discusses the AIDS crisis and progress. COMMERCIAL: 550-GAYS6. Anti-gay followers of Pat Robertson harass gay rights activists at a gay rights rally at Lafayette Square.COMMERCIAL: The "Tyte" Party Line, for men only7. RNC attendees react to ACTUP demonstration/counter-demonstration.COMMERCIAL: Village Pointe Condos8. At the RNC, interview with Angela Buchanan who talks about children being taught about the "gay lifestyle". COMMERCIAL: 550-9000, presented by the Megaquest Group9. At RNC, interviews with correspondents of non-gay news outlets. COMMERCIAL: 550-GAYS10. At RNC, attendees discuss their support of George H.W. Bush; Urvashi Vaid discusses her opposition to Bush.COMMERCIAL: Gay Pride Parade & Christopher Street Festival 1988 videoCOMMERCIAL: The "Tyte" Party Line, for men only
